column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=What did that signify to you ?
#Text=What it showed me is that the mentality in Atlanta is that much of their history means nothing .
#Text=For so many years they did a good job preserving .
#Text=Do n’t get me wrong , I ’m not a preservationist .
#Text=It ’s just an interesting observation .
#Text=In 2004 when you released your third album , Red Hot , it received a good deal of play in the clubs and on dance radio , but very little press coverage .
#Text=On your blog you discussed how you felt betrayed by the entertainment industry and , in particular , the gay press .
#Text=What happened ?
#Text=Well , betrayed might be the wrong word .
#Text=‘ Betrayed ’ alludes to an idea that there was some kind of a promise made to me , and there never was .
#Text=More so , I was disappointed .
#Text=I do n’t feel like it was a betrayal .
#Text=Nobody promises anything in show business and you understand that from day one .
#Text=But , I do n’t know what happened .
#Text=It seemed I could n’t get press on my album unless I was willing to play into the role that the mainstream press has assigned to gay people , which is as servants of straight ideals .
#Text=Do you mean as court jesters ?
#Text=Not court jesters , because that also plays into that mentality .
#Text=We as humans find it easy to categorize people so that we know how to feel comfortable with them ; so that we do n’t feel threatened .
#Text=If someone falls outside of that categorization , we feel threatened and we search our psyche to put them into a category that we feel comfortable with .
#Text=The mainstream media and the gay press find it hard to accept me as ... just ...
#Text=Everything you are ?
#Text=Everything that I am .

#Text=It seems like years ago , and my recollection might be fuzzy , but it seems like I read a mainstream media piece that talked about how you wanted to break out of the RuPaul ' character ' and be seen as more than just RuPaul .
#Text=Well , RuPaul is my real name and that ’s who I am and who I have always been .
#Text=There ’s the product RuPaul that I have sold in business .
#Text=Does the product feel like it ’s been put into a box ?
#Text=Could you be more clear ?
#Text=It ’s a hard question to answer .
#Text=That you wanted to be seen as more than just RuPaul the drag queen , but also for the man and versatile artist that you are .
#Text=That ’s not on target .
#Text=What other people think of me is not my business .
#Text=What I do is what I do .
#Text=How people see me does n’t change what I decide to do .
#Text=I do n’t choose projects so people do n’t see me as one thing or another .
#Text=I choose projects that excite me .
#Text=I think the problem is that people refuse to understand what drag is outside of their own belief system .
#Text=A friend of mine recently did the Oprah show about transgendered youth .

#Text=It was obvious that we , as a culture , have a hard time trying to understand the difference between a drag queen , transsexual , and a transgender , yet we find it very easy to know the difference between the American baseball league and the National baseball league , when they are both so similar .
#Text=We ’ll learn the difference to that .
#Text=One of my hobbies is to research and go underneath ideas to discover why certain ones stay in place while others do not .
#Text=Like Adam and Eve , which is a flimsy fairytale story , yet it is something that people believe ; what , exactly , keeps it in place ?
